required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Us vs Fluoroscopic Guided Renal Access
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasonography Versus Fluoroscopic Guided Renal Access

brief_summary.textblock: this present study is to compare the result of fluoroscopy, ultrasonography (US) in the guidance of percutaneous nephrostomy pcn .

detailed_description.textblock: investigators will enroll 100 patients who are candidates for PCN in the study. By simple random sampling technique, patients will be assigned to two patient groups (group 1, US-guided approach , group 2, fluoroscopy-guided approach.The end point of the study is the comparison of outcome of procedure including stone free rate, transfusion rate, operation time, access time, length of stay and complications.

primary_outcome.description: The time taken for make a puncture
time taken from patient putted on table until end of operation
the rate success of intervention by u/s or by fluoroscopy

secondary_outcome.description: numbers of patients with Adverse effects occures intra operative ,bleeding ,extravasation
Compare preoperative and post operative Hg concentration

arm_group.description: The use of ultrasound to make a puncture in kidney for pcn for drainage or evaluation of function or for shunt of urine
The use of fluoroscopy to make a puncture in kidney for pcn for drainage or evaluation of function or for shunt of urine

intervention.description: The use of a needle for entering pelvicalyceal system of the kidney and put a guide wire for further pcn

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- infected hydronephrotic kidney onen's grade 2-3
- obstructed good cortex with backpressure changes onen's grade 2-3 .
- Evaluation of function of asymptomatic hydronephrotic kidney thin cortex onen's grade 4
Exclusion Criteria:
- congenital anomalies of kidney
- patient underwent transplant or urinary diversion
- solitary kidney

overall_contact.last_name: Mostafa K Abdel rahman, A lecturer
